intro: Duvernoia tenuis, commonly known as the slender duvernoia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and alternate, simple leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
